doc:
Francis Powers https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Powers 0 Francis Gary Powers (August 17, 1929 – August 1, 1977)—often referred to as simply Gary Powers—was an American pilot whose Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) U-2 spy plane was shot down while flying a reconnaissance mission in Soviet Union airspace, causing the 1960 U-2 incident. He later worked as a helicopter pilot for KNBC and died in a 1977 helicopter crash. Francis_Gary_Powers ( August_17_,_1929 – August_1_,_1977 ) —_often_referred to as_simply_Gary_Powers — was an_American_pilot whose_Central_Intelligence_Agency ( CIA ) U-2_spy_plane was_shot down while flying a_reconnaissance_mission in Soviet_Union_airspace , causing the_1960_U-2_incident . He later worked as a_helicopter_pilot for KNBC and died in a_1977_helicopter_crash .
